a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes A B M :: "real^2^2"
assumes h0 : "A = matrix ([[1, -4], [3, -2]])"
and h1 : "B = matrix ([[-16, -6], [7, 2]])"
and h2 : "M ** A = B"
shows  "M = matrix ([[5, -7], [-2, 3]])"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the matrix $\mathbf{M}$ such that
\[\mathbf{M} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & -4 \\ 3 & -2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} -16 & -6 \\ 7 & 2 \end{pmatrix}.\] The final Answer is \begin{pmatrix} 5 & -7 \\ -2 & 3 \end{pmatrix}
 ### Proof
 The inverse of $\begin{pmatrix} 1 & -4 \\ 3 & -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is \[\frac{1}{(1)(-2) - (-4)(3)} \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 4 \\ -3 & 1 \end{pmatrix} = \frac{1}{10} \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 4 \\ -3 & 1 \end{pmatrix}.\]So, multiplying by this inverse on the right, we get
 \[\mathbf{M} = \begin{pmatrix} -16 & -6 \\ 7 & 2 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \frac{1}{10} \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 4 \\ -3 & 1 \end{pmatrix} = \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 5 & -7 \\ -2 & 3 \end{pmatrix}}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes A B M :: "real^2^2"
assumes h0 : "A = matrix ([[1, -4], [3, -2]])"
and h1 : "B = matrix ([[-16, -6], [7, 2]])"
and h2 : "M ** A = B"
shows  "M = matrix ([[5, -7], [-2, 3]])"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given two matrices $A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & -4 \\ 3 & -2 \end{bmatrix}$ and $B = \begin{bmatrix} -16 & -6 \\ 7 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$, find a matrix $M$ such that $M \times A = B$. The final answer is $M = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & -7 \\ -2 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$.

\[\mathbf{M} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & -4 \\ 3 & -2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} -16 & -6 \\ 7 & 2 \end{pmatrix}.\] The final Answer is \begin{pmatrix} 5 & -7 \\ -2 & 3 \end{pmatrix}

 The inverse of $\begin{pmatrix} 1 & -4 \\ 3 & -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is \[\frac{1}{(1)(-2) - (-4)(3)} \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 4 \\ -3 & 1 \end{pmatrix} = \frac{1}{10} \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 4 \\ -3 & 1 \end{pmatrix}.\]So, multiplying by this inverse on the right, we get

assumes h0 : "A = matrix([[1, -4], [3, -2]])"
and h1 : "B = matrix([[-16, -6], [7, 2]])"
and h2 : "M ** A = B"
shows  "M = matrix([[5, -7], [-2, 3]])"

assumes h0 : "\<forall> A B. M ** A = B"

 *)

fixes M :: "real^2^2"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> A B. M ** A = B"
and h1 : "A = matrix([[1, -4], [3, -2]])"
and h2 : "B = matrix([[-16, -6], [7, 2]])"
shows  "M = matrix([[5, -7], [-2, 3]])"
